name: bamboo forestry, sustainable forest management | bamboo culm | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24994/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 Kg of bamboo culm which is the stem of bamboo. Although bamboo culm is not itself considered a construction material, the culm is used for the production of bamboo pole which can be used directly for the construction of columns, beams, or struts and other bamboo-based construction materials. Each species of bamboo yields different numbers of culms per year. This number can be influenced by fertiliser use and natural events (Liu et al., 2011). The culms can be extracted manually or using a chainsaw but lack a direct application as a construction material because their high water content (u= ca. 80 %), and when untreated their service life is approximately three years (De Flander and Rovers, 2009; Riaño et al., 2002). The production takes place at a bamboo forest or intermediary processing facility. The figures origin from mainly calculations and literature values. This dataset was developed with the support of the International Organization for Bamboo and Rattan INBAR.;Ref:;De Flander, K. and R. Rovers, One laminated bamboo-frame house per hectare per year. Construction and Building Materials, 2009. 23(1): p. 210-218. ;Liu, J., et al., Seasonal soil CO2 efflux dynamics after land use change from a natural forest to Moso bamboo plantations in subtropical China. Forest Ecology and Management, 2011. 262(6): p. 1131-1137. ;Riaño, N.M., et al., Plant growth and biomass distribution on Guadua angustifolia Kunth in relation to ageing in the Valle del Cauca – Colombia. Bamboo Science and Culture, 2002. 16(1): p. 43-51. ;Zea Escamilla, E. and Habert, G., Environmental impacts from the production of bamboo based construction materials representing the global production diversity. Journal of Cleaner Production, 2013

From transformation of land into Bamboo Forest and reception of fertilisers.

This activity ends with Bamboo Culm (u=80%) at forest. The dataset includes the CO2 absorption from air and the land use for the bamboo to grow. Since branches and leaves stay on the ground in the forest, i.e. do not leave the system, they are neglected in this dataset. The dataset does not include infrastructure, soil preparation, changes in carbon content in soil, use of pesticides, irrigation, and plantation of seedling, leaching of and leaching of pesticides and fertilisers.
All transport for this product is included in the respective market activity.
At the plantation there is no mechanical transport, since plantations are rather small and the bamboo groove is very dense and cannot be easily accessed by vehicles. The culms will be trimmed and the pulled/transported to a collection point, where they can be picked up.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/023:Gathering of non-wood forest products/0230:Gathering of non-wood forest products

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The input of bamboo is approximated with “wood, unspecified, standing”. The properties have been modified in order to reflect bamboo (Species: Dendrocalamus asper)
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The dataset is mostly based on literature values and was developed with the support of the International Organization for Bamboo and Rattan INBAR

A rotation period of 5 years is assumed but only 25% of the culms are extracted during this time period. Thus, only after 20 years the whole area will be harvested.

exchanges.description: dry mass of the culm x gross calorific value of bamboo

flow.name: Energy, gross calorific value, in biomass

exchanges.description: This input is used as a proxy to reflect bamboo, standing. The water properties have been adjusted according to the properties of the specific bamboo species (Dendrocalamus asper)

Carbon dioxide released from urea application, according to IPCC (2006). Roughly 56 % of inorganic nitrogen fertiliser is assumed to be urea. All Carbon in urea is assumed to form CO2 which is then emitted to air. CO2 emissions are caluclated as C_content_urea/ C_content_CO2*Amount_Urea. The share of urea (i.e. 56 %) is based on the market shares of the Brazilian market for "inorganic nitrogen fertiliser, as N".

Value has been calculated based on an average yearly harvest of 49000 Kg per hectare. The value is specific for Dendrocalamus Asper bamboo.  A rotation period of 5 years is assumed but only 25% of the culms are extracted during this time period. Thus, only after 20 years the whole area will be harvested.

Carbon uptake from air into the product calculated based on the carbon content and dry mass of the product. Scaled to the molar mass from C to CO2. Branches and leaves are not taken into account, since they do not leave the system.
Reported as 60000 [g/ha year] of Nitrogen per 22000000 [g/ha year] of bamboo culm.
